pageContent: Background: Active surveillance (AS) is emerging as an alternative approach to limit the risk of overtreatment and impairment of quality of life (QoL) in patients with low-risk localised prostate cancer. Although most patients report high levels of QoL, some men may be distressed by the idea of living with untreated cancer.

metaData.source:
Promise and challenge: Markers of prostate cancer detection, diagnosis and prognosis
